reviews.review_msg: Can not speak english clearly.  You cant understand a word she says. Her assignment outlines do not make sense.  She does not have any exams so you dont have to do the readings only for the papers you use them.  Really nice but the worst prof I have EVER had (including highschool) and I'm in forth year.

Xing is such a sweetheart! Although he might be a bit difficult to understand at first, his well of knowledge of China is vast. He is very supportive, understanding and has a good sense of humour. I learned so much in his class! Make sure you do the readings, follow the grading criteria, and participate and you'll succeed.

Took Media & Popular Culture in China.  The course material was very eye opening and his enthusiasm for the material made it all the more enjoyable.  One of those classes that you learn so much and actually enjoy engaging with the material because the pressure is off.  Follow his guidelines and I do not see how one cannot earn an A.

Interesting course but very boring class. He judges students based on how hard you "look" like you work (ie. talk in class/converse with him/interested face). Got an A entirely from doing the readings and a good group presentation, don't remember a single thing from class even though I went all the time. Laptop is a must to endure the 4 hours.
Even he does not have a adequate english  speaking ability, but his class is okay, you may learn something from his class, and also it is not very hard at all.
i think he is okay, learn something, and dont need to do a lot of works though.
His lecture is soooo boring, and lots of readings for every week!!

He spends the entire class answering "discussion questions" from students. Does not provide his own presentation, simply depend on students' presentation and have no consideration for students that are NOT Chinese. i.e random Chinese characters written on board

The course itself is more like a discussion group, which means students participation is very important. However, the class is always half empty..... Guoxin is a very nice prof and he is definitely passionate about what he is teaching. He is really willing to help students too.

Byron is a great professor, he really brings theories to life and explains them really well. You just have to be prepared to get a lot of information during lectures. It is a 400 level course and if you don't have a basic grasp on fundamental communication theories at this point then of course you'll find it difficult. But otherwise, it's fun :)

Professor Hauck is the most amazing prof in CMNS! I would love to take another with him. The workload is quite low, if you pay attention in class and do your readings you will receive a excellent grade.
